tutorial.title: Express Basics
tutorial.descriptionContent: Challenges are more difficult exercises that will test your skills.

executableContent.instructions:
Create an app using Express. Then make the app listen to port `3000`.

1. Call the `listen()` function using the `app` variable.
2. Set `PORT` as the first parameter of the `listen()` function and a callback arrow function as the second parameter.
3. In the callback function, use `console.log` to print the following message.
```
`The server is listening on port ${PORT}`
```

files.name: app.js

executableContent.instructions:
Enhance the code for the app to handle GET requests to send a message in the response.

1. Call the `get()` function using the `app` variable.
2. Set`/` as the first parameter and a callback function with `req` and `res` as its parameters as the second parameter of the `get()` function.
3. In the callback function, call `res.send()` to send `"Success!"`.

files.name: app.js

executableContent.instructions:
Use the app to send a status code along with a message in the response when receiving GET requests. 1. In the callback function of the `get()` function, call the `status()` function using `res`. 2. Set `200` as the status of the response. 3. After the `status()` function, call the `send()` function to send the following: ``` "

Welcome

" ```

files.name: app.js

executableContent.instructions:
The "FittnessFriend" App needs a route for its homepage!

1. Give the `GET` route a path of `/home`.

files.name: app.js

executableContent.instructions:
For this `GET` route, we'll send back all the food data to a user.

1. Give the `GET` route a path of `/foods/today`.

files.name: app.js

executableContent.instructions:
A local restaurant is in the process of setting up their online menu! Let's help them by completing this `GET` route which uses a single parameter.

1. Give the `GET` route a path of `/foods/today/:searchedFood`.

files.name: app.js
